text:
hey all,

I'm trying to create a child theme from a marketplace theme to add functionality to specific modules.

However, when I update the page to use this new theme it destroys the DND editor view, it looks flawless when previewing the page but turns to this monster for page editors.

I've tried copying over all the style and script files over to the child in hopes that it was caused by not fetching parent files correctly, but even that leaves the page looking like this.

I've also tried it on two different devices with different browsers and asked colleagues to check, all see this.

Any idea why this could happen and how it could be fixed? As currently I'm out of ideas and the support team is also not fully sure why it's happening

Hi <@U062KB9HSG0>
Have you tried checking for console errors while in the content editor?

Hey question. Can I set a variable from `format_date` in a for loop? BTW I want to group some date, like May 5, 7 June 23 from a Module with sometimes from that one date... ```

Item dates:

    {% for date in item.dates %} {% set month_day = date | format_date('MMMM') %} <- NOT WORK
  • {{ date | format_date('MMMM dd') }}
    • <- WORKS {% endfor %}
  • Month: {{month_day}}
    • <- NOT WORK
```
